name: Immediate release oral morphine liquid
title: Immediate release oral morphine liquid
description: Milligrams of immediate release oral morphine liquid per 1000 patients
numerator_short: mg of liquid oral morphine formulations
why_it_matters: Oral liquid morphine has been implicated in a number of <a href='https://pharmaceutical-journal.com/article/feature/investigation-should-liquid-morphine-be-reclassified' target='_Blank'>drug-related
deaths in the NHS. There have been some concerns regarding accidental overdose, due to the ability to 'swig' the bottle, compared to using solid or orodispersible formulations.
Despite these risks, oral liquid morphine is classified as a Schedule 5 Controlled Drug, meaning it is subject to fewer regulatory controls than Schedule 2 morphine tablets.
This classification reduces prescribing, storage and record keeping requirements, potentially leading it to be perceived as a simple option to give as a just in case of pain at discharge.
Morphine oral solution also contains high quantities of alcohol and sugar as excipients. For example,
branded Oramorph contains 90g of sugar and 24g of ethanol (equivalent to 3 units of alcohol) in each 300ml bottle.
You can read more about the rationale behind this measure, and the wider considerations surrounding the use of oral liquid morphine,
numerator_from:
{hscic}.normalised_prescribing p
INNER JOIN {dmd}.vmp vmp ON CONCAT(SUBSTR(p.bnf_code,0,9),'AA', SUBSTR(p.bnf_code,-2), SUBSTR(p.bnf_code,-2)) = vmp.bnf_code -- joins prescribing data to vmp table using generic BNF code 
INNER JOIN {dmd}.vpi AS vpi ON vmp.id = vpi.vmp -- joins vmp to vpi table to get ingredient strengths (strnt_nmrtr_val) 
INNER JOIN {dmd}.ont AS ont ON vmp.id = ont.vmp -- joins vmp to ont table to get formulation codes 
INNER JOIN {dmd}.ontformroute AS route ON ont.form = route.cd -- joins ont table to ontform table to get formulation names
numerator_where: vpi.ing = 60886004 AND route.descr = ('solution.oral') -- morphine oral solution preparations
testing_comments: Simple test to identify new morphine products. The measure relies on dm+d codes/route so this test might over identify products.
